topic.title: How to Set Fonts for Displaying Music

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p: Music is rendered as normal text in the majority of fonts, but some of them will render them as musical glyphs. For example the MusGlyphs font converts the text as music and adjust it to the surrounding text.

This font is divided in 2 sub-fonts that acts for each of the following categories:
MusGlyphs converts all the characters matching a musical pattern into music, it should be used inside the elements that contains only music.
MusGlyphs-Text converts only the text prefixed with the @ symbol into music, the remaining text is displayed normally.
